Image of selected fruit
Apple
Red and juicy
Apples are a great source of fiber and vitamin C. They\'re widely loved for their crisp texture and sweet-tart flavor.
Banana
Rich in potassium
Bananas are high in potassium, help regulate blood pressure, and provide a quick energy boost from natural sugars.
Grapes
Sweet and small
Grapes are antioxidant-rich and come in many colors. They are used for making raisins, juice, jelly, and wine.
Kiwi
Tangy green fruit with fuzzy skin
Kiwis are loaded with vitamin C and dietary fiber, and their seeds contain omega-3 fatty acids. They’re native to China.
Watermelon
Juicy summer fruit with sweet red flesh
Made of over 90% water, watermelon is super hydrating and contains lycopene, an antioxidant that supports heart health.
Pineapple
Tropical fruit with a spiky crown and tart sweetness
Pineapples aid digestion due to bromelain, an enzyme that breaks down protein. They’re also high in vitamin C and manganese.
Strawberry
Bright red and heart-shaped with a sweet bite
Strawberries are rich in antioxidants and vitamin C. They’re commonly associated with love and springtime treats.
Mango
Smooth, golden flesh with rich tropical flavor
Known as the “king of fruits,” mangoes are high in vitamin A and beta-carotene, supporting eye and skin health.
Orange
Classic citrus fruit, sweet and full of vitamin C
Oranges are one of the best sources of vitamin C. They support the immune system and can help reduce inflammation.
Raspberry
Tiny, velvety berries with a tart punch
Raspberries are high in fiber and vitamin C, and are often used in desserts, jams, and smoothies.
Blueberry
Smooth-skinned, deep blue, and mildly sweet
Blueberries are known for their brain-boosting properties and are considered a superfood.
Dragon Fruit
Bright pink skin, speckled white flesh, subtly sweet
Dragon fruit is rich in fiber, magnesium, and antioxidants, and is known for its unique appearance and subtle sweetness.
